tag_professor: Respected (2)  Inspirational (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Caring (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: One of the best professors I have had at FIU so far. His manner of teaching and explaining certain concepts conveys his deep passion for the material. Extremely funny guy if you have an open sense of humor. Other than that he\'s been a great inspiration and possibly looking into land ecology because of him.

tag_professor: Respected (2)  Inspirational (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Caring (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: Dr. Ross is an interesting man who has a strong background of SFL. He loves research, the field. His lectures may come off as boring to some because it is so full of info, but it is that way because of his interest. He curves and usually is at his office if you need any help. 3 exams, Quiz once a week, presentation on species.

tag_professor: Respected (2)  Inspirational (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Caring (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
stu_tags: GIVES GOOD FEEDBACK  SKIP CLASS? YOU WON\'T PASS.
comments: I didn\'t know what to expect coming into this class. Overall, it\'s not a bad class. It can be very, very dry but he does his hardest to make it interesting. You NEED to have the book because its supports his PowerPoints. A few exams and a presentation determined my grade. Was it hard this class? No, but you need to have an interest in it like I do.

tag_professor: Respected (2)  Inspirational (2)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (1)  Caring (1)  Gives good feedback (1)
comments: Lectures drag out but what he\'s got to say is pretty damn interesting. Drag yourself to class, grades attendance. Study the graphs he uses and you\'ll be fine. I recommend.

comments: He is total tool, the worst prof. that I have ever had. He talks about nothing relevant to the 21st century and attending his class is like watching paint dry on a wall. He is VERY boring and should not be allowed to teach anyone let alone Graduate students
